alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 6:51PM EDT until June 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Maine, including the following counties, in southwest Maine, Androscoggin. In western Maine, Oxford. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Small streams may swell with large amounts of rainfall occuring nearby. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Livermore, Hartford, Sumner, Peru and Woodstock.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
